net.java.jddac.common.util
Class ConditionEval

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.util.ConditionEval

public class ConditionEval
extends java.lang.Object

Evalutates user specified conditions and generates a result. The evaluator accepts an ArgArray or Vector which specifies the conditions to evaluate. If the condition is a Vector then the evaluation assumes an implicit and operation on the vector contents. If the condition is an ArgArray then it must contain a single condition. Some conditions such as and and or may consist of a Vector of conditions. By combining the various conditions and taking advantage of recursion, an arbitrary logical expression can be expressed and evaluated. Each element in the ArgArray can itself be another Vector of conditions or it can specify a terminal condition such as existance of a property or object. Every condition ArgArray has an element named "type" that specifies the condition. Depending on the condition, additional attributes are included in the ArgArray to specify how the condition is to be evaluted.

Condition "type" attribute attribute type Description
if     Evaluates an expression to a boolean result and then chooses either a then clause or an else clause as the result. If the expression is true and the then clause is not specified, the result is considered to be the result of the if expression.
  expr varies An expression that is evaluated to a boolean.
  then varies The result when expr evaluates to true.
  else varies The result when expr evaluates to false.
ifobj     Evaluates an expression and considers it to be true if it is not null. If the expression is true and the then clause is not specified, the result is considered to be the result of the if expression before conversion to boolean. This is most often used in conjunction with argExtract to check for the presence of a field. It can also be used to check the existance of properties.
  expr varies An expression considered true if it is not null.
  then varies The result when expr evaluates to true.
  else varies The result when expr evaluates to false.
not     Invert the specified condition
  cond ArgArray A single condition to be evaluated.
  invert String true or false, default is false. If true then the condition test is inverted. This attribute can be included with any of the conditions.
and     The and element has a single attribute that specifies a vector of conditions to be evaluated. This condition is true if all of its contained conditions are, conditions will be evaluated in the order they have been specified in the vector and processing stops on the first false condition.
  cond Vector A list of conditions to be evaluated.
or     The and element has a single attribute that specifies a vector of conditions to be evaluated. This condition is true if any of its contained conditions are, conditions will be evaluated in the order they have been specified in the vector and processing stops on the first true condition.
  cond Vector A list of conditions to be evaluated.
object     Determine the existance of an object by looking it up in the registry.
  name String The name of an object to look up in the object registry.
property     Determine the existance of a system property using the System#getProperty method. If the System#getProperty method returns null then the NCAP registry is queried for an object of the same name. If the property does not exist then false is returned. If value is specified then the property must exist and contain the string specified by value to return true.
  name String The name of property to query.
  value varies A string which must match the property using a regex compare that only supports '.*' wildcards.
containedBy     Determines if a value is contained by the limites specified by lowerBound and upperLimit. If the object is a Location instance then the Location.containedBy(Location, Location) method is used. If the object is a numeric type then lowerBound and upperLimit specify the lower and upper bounds which must contain the object. That is, lowerBound <= object <= upperLimit. If either the lowerBound or the upperBound is not specified then it is not utilized in the comparison. This allows a less than test or a greater than test by only specifying one of the attributes.
  value varies Value to check against boundary.
  lowerBound varies The first boundary.
  upperBound varies The second boundary.
  list varies A list of allowable values. The list can be any suitable array type among byte[], int[], long[], Location[], Float64[], String[], or Object[]. If the value does not match any items in the list then the condition is considered to be false. If the list is a String array then a simplified regex pattern match is used where the only regex pattern supported is '.*'.
equals     Determines if two values are equal. The equals method on the object is used for the determination unless the value is a String. If the value is a String then a simplified regex pattern match is used where the only regex pattern supported is '.*'.
  v1 varies The first value to compare against.
  v1 varies The second value to compare against.
argExtract     Extract an object from an ArgArray. The fields attribute specifies how to navigate the ArgArray to extract the value.
  fields Vector A list of names to recursively decend into the ArgArray and extract elements. If a Vector is encountered in the ArgArray then the field name is treated as an ordinal index into the Vector.
  exists boolean true or false, default is false. If true then the result is true if the object exists. This attribute can be included with any of the conditions.
  invert boolean true or false, default is false. If true then the result is treated as a boolean and inverted from it's normal return value. This attribute can be included with any of the conditions.
  default   Specifies the default value if the condition evaluates to a null value. If null, then the result is replaced with the value specified.
concat     Concatenate as strings a list of items in the contained vector. Any items that are null are ignored.
  list vector A list of items that are converted to string and concatenated.
* Examples: 
   <!-- and together a vector of conditions -->
   <argArray>
     <arg n="type">and</arg>
     <argArray n="cond" t="vector">
       <!-- N conditions -->
     </argArray
   </argArray>
   
   <!-- Check for a property with the string foobar it -->
   <argArray>
      <arg n="type">property</arg>
      <arg n="name">microedition.profiles"</arg>
      <arg n="value">.*foobar.*</arg>
   </argArray>
  
   <!-- negate a single condition -->
   <argArray>
     <arg n="type">not</arg>
     <argArray n="cond">
       <arg n="type">any condition</arg>
       <!-- rest of condition specification -->
     </argArray
   </argArray>
  
   <!-- extract an element from an ArgArray</arg>
   <argArray>
      <arg n="type">argExtract</arg>
      <argArray n="fields" t="vector">
           <arg>Memory Usage TIM?ch=freeMemory</arg>
           <arg>value</arg>
      </argArray>
   </argArray>
  
   <!-- Check for a Measurement value within a range -->
   <argArray>
      <arg n="type">containedBy</arg>
      <argArray n="value">
         <arg n="type">argExtract</arg>
         <argArray n="fields" t="vector">
           <arg>Memory Usage TIM?ch=freeMemory</arg>
           <arg>value</arg>
         </argArray>
      </argArray>
      <arg n="lowerBound">1000000</arg>
      <arg n="upperBound">2000000</arg>
   <<argArray>

Method Detail

evaluate

public java.lang.Object evaluate(java.lang.Object condition)
Evaluate a condition specification and return the result.

Parameters:
condition - An ArgArray or Vector containing the condition(s) to evaluate.
Returns:
- The condition result.

evaluateToBool

public boolean evaluateToBool(java.lang.Object condition,
                              java.lang.Object arg)
Evaluate a condition specification and force a true or false result. Most of the conditions available return a Boolean object. This method assumes the result value is either a Boolean or a numeric value. If the result is a numeric value then this method returns true if the numeric value is non-zero. The argExtract condition assumes the presence of an ArgArray or Vector from which values can be extracted to use in the condition evaluation. The arg argument provides this argument to the expression evaluator.

Parameters:
condition - An ArgArray or Vector containing the condition(s) to evaluate.
arg - An object to pass to utilize in some conditions that require an external object.
Returns:
the boolean expression result

evaluate

public java.lang.Object evaluate(java.lang.Object condition,
                                 java.lang.Object arg)
Evaluate a condition specification and return the result. Most of the conditions available return a Boolean object but this is dependant on the nature of the specified condition. Use the evaluateToBool(Object, Object) method if a boolean result is preferred. The argExtract condition assumes the presence of an ArgArray or Vector from which values can be extracted to use in the condition evaluation. The arg argument provides this argument to the expression evaluator. If any internal exceptinos are detected, a new Boolean(false); is returned.

Parameters:
condition - An ArgArray or Vector containing the condition(s) to evaluate.
arg - An object to pass to utilize in some conditions that require an external object.
Returns:
The condition evaluation result.
